overview_of_class:
Professor Jean Clipperton, Fall 2016, Intro Probability & Statistics
This course is designed to teach you the basics of single variable calculus, probability, set theory, random variables, and hypothesis testing. The course prepares students for the next class in the statistics sequence: 405, Linear Models. The only prerequisite is to have taken the ALEKS exam and online learning module if necessary.
Professor Jean Clipperton Bio:
Research Interest(s): Comparative Politics; Methodology
My research interests include institutional design and change, the influence of institutions on behavior, and the interaction between institutions and behavior. Recently, I have focused on how states create effective laws, the determinants of effective legislation, and the effect of legislative choices on outcomes, like constitutional longevity. My work incorporates ideas and approaches from political science, complex systems and social sciences more generally
name: Introduction to Probability and Statistics
title: WCAS POLI_SCI 403-0-20 Introduction to Probability and Statistics
